DataElement.preferredDefinition: The longest dimension/diameter of a tumor, represented as a numeric value.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Results Domain Neoplasm Longest Diameter
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A findings domain that represents quantitative measurements and/or qualitative assessments of the tumors identified in the TU domain._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._The longest possible length of a straight line passing through the center of a circular or spheroid object that connects two points on the circumference.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A findings domain that represents quantitative measurements and/or qualitative assessments of the tumors identified in the TU domain.

Concepts.definition: A findings domain that represents quantitative measurements and/or qualitative assessments of the tumors identified in the TU domain.

Property.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.:The longest possible length of a straight line passing through the center of a circular or spheroid object that connects two points on the circumference.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
The longest possible length of a straight line passing through the center of a circular or spheroid object that connects two points on the circumference.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 3243681 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.
